meanings.definition: The first pair of appendages on a crustacean or insect.
meanings.sent1: The protopods of the insect help it to move around.
meanings.sent2: The crab's protopods are used for grabbing food.
meanings.sent3: The protopods of the shrimp had a dance-off competition.
meanings.sent4: The protopods of the lobster waved in the water like graceful dancers.
meanings.sent5: The protopods of the beetle were as tiny as delicate twigs.

meanings.definition: A primitive or ancestral form of a limb or appendage.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the protopods to understand limb evolution.
meanings.sent2: The fossil showed the protopods of ancient creatures.
meanings.sent3: The protopods in the museum seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: The protopods on the statue symbolized the beginning of life.
meanings.sent5: The protopods in the rock formation were like ancient treasures waiting to be discovered.
